desc: Developments in the field of computing now allow undergraduates to create effective and innovative applications of powerful computing techniques in any target discipline. This seminar brings computer science (CS) students together with students in target (non-CS) disciplines to create interdisciplinary software applications involving modern high-performance computing that are useful for research and/or teaching in those disciplines. Current projects are in linguistics, environmental science, psychology, mathematics, finance, and robotics. Students should contact the instructor (rab@stolaf.edu) before registering for this seminar.
name: Top: Pwr Comptg-All Disc
notes: During course submission process, include only course (not lab). Lab will be registered after submission ends on November 7. First years may register on space-available basis with permission of instructor during drop/add period.
title: Power Computing in All Disciplines
